{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2504.01491v1", "title": "How to Define the Quality of Data? A Feature-Based Literature Survey", "summary": "The digital transformation of our society is a constant challenge, as data is
generated in almost every digital interaction. To use data effectively, it must
be of high quality. This raises the question: what exactly is data quality? A
systematic literature review of the existing literature shows that data quality
is a multifaceted concept, characterized by a number of quality dimensions.
However, the definitions of data quality vary widely. We used feature-oriented
domain analysis to specify a taxonomy of data quality definitions and to
classify the existing definitions. This allows us to identify research gaps and
future topics.", "main_category": "cs.DB", "categories": "cs.DB", "published": "2025-04-02T08:46:19Z"}
